intro: Allosorus bridgesii, commonly known as the Bridgess' alpine aster, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, adapted to reduce water loss in harsh climates. Allosorus bridgesii produces showy purple or blue flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
